pageContext.claim: “I think what Secretary Kerry did, if there was ever a reason for the Logan Act, I thought what Secretary Kerry did was horrible, because he made it, we could have had a deal with Iran. And frankly, he broke it up. Kerry's lucky that we have a very fine Attorney General that treats people well, because if there was ever a case for the Logan Act, it certainly wasn't Flynn. It was Kerry.”
pageContext.analysis: Kerry, the former secretary of state, said he had one conversation with the Iranian foreign minister in Germany after Trump withdrew the United States from the Iran nuclear deal. He denied any inappropriate contacts.
